body: I cannot reproduce this. Please provide a minimal, self-containted, recproducing test case.
Sounds like an old version of phpunit is being used here.
`Error: Access to undeclared static property: Abc::$xxxx` is not a syntax but a runtime error. Will investigate the PHPUnit problem, though.
Seems to only happen for errors triggered `setUpBeforeClass()`, not in `setUp()` or `test*()`.
Ah thanks, sorry for my describing the problem wrong; you are correct.

c3db067ba2f64843d6038c6dc9c51eca794f5e06 should fix this but it breaks backwards compatibility, meaning it cannot got into 5.x :-(

Maybe I (or somebody else) can come up with a different solution that does not break BC.
Thanks so much for fixing this!

issue.title: PHP 7.0 / PHPunit 5.1 support
issue.body:
I couldn't find an issue tracking progress on making Codeception compatible with PHP7.0.
What's missing to make it run with PHPunit 5.1?

> - codeception/codeception 2.1.5 requires phpunit/phpunit ~4.8.0 -> no matching package found.

Related issue: #2730

body:
But like @gmagana said, this is a bandaid: you're just catching and ignoring the underlying error. I'm curious what the root cause is?  Unless I'm misunderstanding the issue...
Thanks
@mfuery I think this has been fixed since that https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/ac2e32c1d87cd8d2689a25e344a87de93858608c commit

Looking for help on how to fix these 3 errors: Can someone provide instructions
Notice: Constant JROUTER_MODE_RAW already defined in libraries/cms/router/router.php on line 17

Notice: Constant JROUTER_MODE_SEF already defined in libraries/cms/router/router.php on line 25

Fatal error: Uncaught TypeError: Argument 1 passed to JErrorPage::render() must be an instance of Exception, instance of ParseError given in libraries/cms/error/page.php:28 Stack trace: #0 [internal function]: JErrorPage::render(Object(ParseError)) #1 {main} thrown in  libraries/cms/error/page.php on line 28
where is the solution should be for the libraries/cms/error/page.php on line 28?
